citation.article-title: Haloquadratum walsbyi gen. nov., sp. nov., the square haloarchaeon of Walsby, isolated from saltern crystallizers in Australia and Spain.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Haloquadratum (Ha.lo.quad.ra′tum. Gr. masc. n. hals, haloes salt; L. neut. n. quadratum square; N.L. neut. n. Haloquadratum salt square).
Flat, square cells that usually contain gas vesicles and PHA storage granules.
Oxidase and catalase tests are negative.
Phylogenetically belonging to the family Halobacteriaceae.
Habitat: salt lakes and saltern crystallizer ponds.
The DNA G+C content of the type species is 46.9 mol%.
The type species is Haloquadratum walsbyi.
Following the published guidelines (Oren & Ventosa, 2000), we propose the three-letter genus abbreviation Hqr.
